intro: Perymenium mendezii, commonly known as the Mexican spurge, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture. The flowers are small and clustered, with a unique structure that includes cyathia, characteristic of the Euphorbiaceae family.
